claim: A video shared in early 2024 showed Taylor Swift holding up a flag at the 2024 Grammy Awards that read, "Trump Won, Democrats Cheated."
content:
On Feb. 4, 2024, a user on X named il Donaldo Trumpo (@PapiTrumpo) – whose account mentions that it posts "a little bit of parody" – posted (archived) a video that appeared to show 14-time Grammy Award-winning recording artist Taylor Swift holding up a flag while walking the red carpet that read, "Trump Won, Democrats Cheated."

While the video may have appeared obviously fake to some users, Elon Musk's social media platform X still showed a label that was displayed under the post that identified it as "manipulated media," adding a link to "find out more" and "stay informed."
The link in the "manipulated media" label led to a policy page on help.twitter.com, which showed that remnants of the old name "Twitter" could still be found on the platform. The page began, "You may not share synthetic, manipulated, or out-of-context media that may deceive or confuse people and lead to harm ('misleading media'). In addition, we may label posts containing misleading media to help people understand their authenticity and to provide additional context."
The original video posted by Variety on Feb. 4 showed Swift simply walking the red carpet and posing for photos, holding no flags or banners of any kind.
Taylor Swift is gorgeous at the #Grammys. https://t.co/Imoq8xlJM9 pic.twitter.com/ydotYDoXFI
— Variety (@Variety) February 5, 2024

As Snopes previously reported, Swift's past expressions of her political beliefs were somewhat the opposite of the idea of embracing false conspiracy theories about the 2020 U.S. presidential election. For example, she previously expressed views in opposition to the politics of former U.S. President Donald Trump and U.S. Sen. Marsha Blackburn of Tennessee – who are both Republicans – in the 2020 documentary "Miss Americana" and on her Instagram account.

original_rationales.main_rationale: While the video may have appeared obviously fake to some users, Elon Musk's social media platform X still showed a label that was displayed under the post that identified it as "manipulated media," adding a link to "find out more" and "stay informed."
original_rationales.additional_rationale1: The link in the "manipulated media" label led to a policy page on help.twitter.com, which showed that remnants of the old name "Twitter" could still be found on the platform. The page began, "You may not share synthetic, manipulated, or out-of-context media that may deceive or confuse people and lead to harm ('misleading media'). In addition, we may label posts containing misleading media to help people understand their authenticity and to provide additional context."
original_rationales.additional_rationale2: As Snopes previously reported, Swift's past expressions of her political beliefs were somewhat the opposite of the idea of embracing false conspiracy theories about the 2020 U.S. presidential election.

summary_rationales.synthesized_rationale: The claim regarding the video of Taylor Swift holding a flag at the 2024 Grammy Awards reading 'Trump Won, Democrats Cheated' is rated as 'Fake' due to multiple factors. These include the video being flagged as manipulated media, the lack of actual evidence of Swift holding such a flag in the original video, Swift's known political stance against the ideas on the flag, and the endorsement of fact-checking sources like Snopes.

detailed_reasons.reason1: The video was labeled as 'manipulated media' on Elon Musk's platform X, directing users to a policy page on Twitter that prohibits sharing deceptive content. This labeling indicates that the content was intentionally altered or misrepresented.
detailed_reasons.reason2: The original video from the Grammy Awards did not show Taylor Swift holding any flags or banners as claimed in the manipulated video. This lack of evidence contradicts the content of the video shared by il Donaldo Trumpo, questioning its authenticity.
detailed_reasons.reason3: Taylor Swift's public record of speaking out against the political beliefs mentioned on the flag, such as her opposition to Donald Trump and other Republican figures, conflicts with the message implied in the manipulated video. This inconsistency suggests that Swift would be unlikely to support or promote such content.
detailed_reasons.reason4: Fact-checking sources like Snopes have previously reported on Swift's political views, emphasizing her disapproval of conspiracy theories like those related to election fraud. Given this context, it is improbable that Swift would engage in promoting a message like 'Trump Won, Democrats Cheated,' further discrediting the authenticity of the video.

evidence1:
Taylor Swift is gorgeous at the #Grammys. https://t.co/Imoq8xlJM9 pic.twitter.com/ydotYDoXFI
— Variety (@Variety) February 5, 2024

relationship_with_evidence.main_rationale, evidence1: The evidence provided in the tweet mentioning Taylor Swift at the #Grammys does not directly align with the claim that she held up a flag at the 2024 Grammy Awards with the message 'Trump Won, Democrats Cheated.' The tweet simply comments on Taylor Swift's appearance at the Grammys, which is unrelated to the false claim being fact-checked. Therefore, the evidence is irrelevant to the claim and the main rationale.
